title: Aneurysmal Bone Cysts of the Spine: Two Case Reports
patient: An 8-year-old male pateint admitted to us with right hip and back pain. In his history, he had fallen down from 2 meters. Neurological examination was normal. Spinal MRI revealed ABC on the right side of the 3rd sacral vertebra with an enlargement of 24×19mm(). The second case is under control and no surgical treatment is suggested because of the patient's age and observing no neurological deficits at the patient.
